alert.note: Alert for Marion (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 05 at 10:42PM CST until December 06 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following county, Marion. * WHEN...Until 145 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1039 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to repeated showers. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jasper, South Pittsburg, Kimball, Orme, New Hope and Haletown (guild). - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
